Title: Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street
Author: John Logan

Replies.Reply: A shrill factory whistle blows--
Without warning -- like a thunderbolt -- Todd leaps into the room--
Attend the tale of Sweeney Todd.
The Demon Barber of Fleet Street.
Well, who's to say?
Sweeney pondered and Sweeney planned.
His hands were quick, his fingers strong.
The engine roared, the motor hissed, And who could see how the road would twist...?
Attend the tale of Sweeney Todd, His skin was pale and his eye was odd.
He kept a shop in London town, Of fancy clients and good renown, And what if none of their souls were saved?
By Sweeney, By Sweeney Todd, The Demon Barber of Fleet Street.
Barbing the hook, baiting the trap, Setting it out for the Beadle to snap...
In Sweeney's ledger the entries matched: A Beadle arrived, and a Beadle dispatched...
He shaved the faces of gentlemen Who never thereafter were heard of again.
Swing your razor wide, Sweeney!
Back of his smile, under his word, Sweeney heard music that nobody heard.
Sweeney was smooth, Sweeney was subtle, Sweeney would blink and rats would scuttle.
Attend the tale of Sweeney Todd.
Not Sweeney, Not Sweeney Todd, The Demon Barber of Fleet Street.
Lift your razor high, Sweeney!
His voice was soft, his manner mild.
Sweeney! Sweeney!
Sweeney!
Sweeeeeeeeeeeeeeneeeeeeeeeeeey...
He trod a path that few have trod, Did Sweeney Todd, The Demon Barber of Fleet Street.
His needs are few, his room is bare.
Sweeney wishes the world away, Sweeney's weeping for yesterday, Hugging the blade, waiting the years, Hearing the music that nobody hears.
There! There! There! There!
Attend the tale of Sweeney Todd!
As Sweeney Todd...
... Street!
His needs were few, his room was bare:  THE PRIEST, a lean, severe man with pale skin in clerical attire...
Slyly courted 'im, Sweeney did, Set a sort of a scene 'e did...
To satisfy the hungry god Of Sweeney Todd...
A lavabo and a fancy chair...
A mug of suds and a leather strop, An apron, a towel, a pail and a mop...
Consigned there with a friendly prod From Sweeney Todd, The Demon Barber of Fleet Street.
For neatness he deserves a nod, Does Sweeney Todd...
And those who thought him a simple clod Were soon reconsidering under the sod...
I have sailed the world, beheld its wonders From the Dardanelles To the mountains of Peru, But there's no place like London--!
Mr. Todd...?
Lord ... takes your breath away, doesn't it?
Shadows...?
And the lady, sir ... did she succumb?
Will I see you again?
Until then, my friend.
Ma'am, could tell me whose house this is?
And the young lady who resides there?
I feel you, Johanna, I feel you.
Yes, it's terribly large on the map but I keep getting lost...
It's embarrassing for a sailor to lose his bearings, but, well, there you are.
Yes, sir. The "Bountiful" out of Plymouth.
Sir?
I think there's been some mistake--
I meant no harm--
I'll steal you, Johanna, I'll steal you!
I feel you, Johanna, And one day I'll steal you.
Mr. Todd! Thank God I've found you --
... Oh, I'm sorry, excuse me...

Replies.Reply: A pleasure, ma'am --
-- You see, there's a girl who needs my help -- such a sad girl, and lonely, but beautiful too and--

... It must be a sign that Johanna wants me to help her -- that's her name, Johanna -- and Turpin that of her guardian. A judge of some sort...
... I've met him, Mr. Todd, and he is -
Yes, but -- you see -- I don't know anyone in London --
-- and I need somewhere safe to bring her till I've hired a coach to take us to Plymouth.

... Mr. Todd?

There's a hole in the world Like a great black pit And the vermin of the world Inhabit it And its morals aren't worth What a pig could spit And it goes by the name Of London.

Ghosts.
There was a barber and his wife, And she was beautiful, A foolish barber and his wife, She was his reason and his life, And she was beautiful, And she was virtuous.

Oh, that was many years ago...
